greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimum prime of the form (n^k + (n+1)^k) for k>1, or 0 if such prime does not exist.
comment: Currently a(n) is unknown for n = {11,15,18,20,28,44,46,49,51,52,53,55,57,58,61,62,64,71,73,77,81,83,91,92,94,...}. All n<100 and 1<k<2^10 are checked. All nonzero a(n) have a form n^(2^m) + (n+1)^(2^m). The exponents m are listed in A080121. The first occurrence of each exponent m in A080121 is listed in A122902.
example: a(3) = 337 because 3^4 + 4^4 = 337 is prime but 3^3 + 4^3 = 91 and 3^2 + 4^2 = 25 are composite.
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Sep 18 2006
